Headline: සෙනාලිගේ පියා එංගලන්තයේදී දිවියෙන් සමුගනී
News Content:
අවාසනාවන්ත කොරෝනා වෛරස් ආසාදනයට ගොදුරුවීමෙන් ජනප්‍රිය නිළි සෙනාලි ෆොන්සේකාගේ පියා වන උපාලි ෆොන්සේකා මහතා එංගලන්තයේදී අභාවප්‍රාප්ත වී ඇතැයි වාර්තාවේ.

As of 20th April, there had been about 12500 Covid 19 related deaths in UK. Only 20% of this has been from Black Asian Minority Ethnic (BAME) back ground.Out of this 20% a very high percentage is coming from boroughs such as Harrow, Brent, and Barnet in London. These Borrows have a very high population density of BAME background. So it is natural that the death rate from these areas have contributed to a high number. I am sure that there will be further investigation in to these statistics in the future. But, just like to add something that I have experienced. Some of the households in theses areas of London have very large families (Especially Bangladeshi and Pakistani communities). Some of them have about 9 or 10 members living in the same houses. Many of them have poor English communication abilities and poor hygiene habits. This has contributed to a rapid spread of the virus in such densely populated areas. The point is, if someone is suggesting that BAME communities are treated as second class citizens in UK, it is a totally uneducated opinion that should not made in public, and is a disgrace to NHS where a large number of Doctors and Nurses are also from BAME backgrounds. So, if you have relatives, children, or any other known people in UK, Please don't be afraid that they are treated differently. They are certainly not. I am not saying that we don't have racism in UK. But what some of these people are saying in public are not true.
